item.title: FIFA cuts World Cup tickets prices following global backlash
item.description: FIFA backtracks on high-priced World Cup tickets, with a limited amount of seats to be made available for less than $100.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Alex Carey century carries Australia on day one of third Test against England at Adelaide Oval
item.description: Australia's Alex Carey scores his maiden Ashes century to carry his team to a solid total of 8-326 on day one of the third Test at the Adelaide Oval.

item.title: Celine Cremer search in Tasmanian bushland uncovers water bottle, garbage bag
item.description: Searchers find a water bottle and a garbage bag that may have been used as a poncho in the Tasmanian bushland where Belgian tourist Celine Cremer went missing.

item.title: High Court overturns ruling that NSW government was not liable for light rail delays
item.description: The move clears the way for businesses to seek compensation from the NSW government after the project hampered traders in the city's CBD for four years.

item.title: Steve Smith ruled out of third Ashes Test in Adelaide due to nausea and dizziness
item.description: Pat Cummins says Steve Smith is a "little bit unwell" as Usman Khawaja makes a shock return to Australia's Test team.

item.title: Donald Trump orders blockade of sanctioned oil tankers leaving and entering Venezuela
item.description: US President Donald Trump's move comes a week after the United States seized a sanctioned oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela.

item.title: Why photos are not the most harmful thing we share about our kids online
item.description: Many parents are aware posting photos of their children online comes with risk. But it's not only images that can be harmful for your child.

item.title: Call for action on homelessness as WA government falls short of target to end rough sleeping
item.description: Social services want the WA government to use its significant budget surplus to invest in breaking people out of the cycle of homelessness, after it failed to achieve its goal of ending rough sleeping.

item.title: Gippsland vegetable farm accused of underpaying migrant workers
item.description: The Fair Work Ombudsman has accused Bulmer Farms in Victoria's East Gippsland region of underpaying migrant workers more than $645,000.

item.title: Call for North Brooman nature reserve to protect 70-metre-tall 'Big Spotty'
item.description: Thought to be 500 years old, a 70-metre-tall spotted gum is almost hidden in the middle of a South Coast state forest. Conservationists want the "world champion" tree and the forest it lives in recognised and celebrated.

item.title: World's tallest spotted gum
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Short-term spending rises despite overall budget improvement as Treasury upgrades inflation forecast
item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers and Finance Minister Katy Gallagher hand down their first budget update since the 2025 federal election.

item.title: Multi-division world champion Terence Crawford announces retirement from boxing at age 38
item.description: Multi-division, undefeated world champion Terence Crawford has called time on his legendary boxing career and will hang up the gloves at age 38.

item.title: Increased police powers begin at Adelaide Oval Ashes Test following Bondi attacks
item.description: South Australian Police will be carrying rifles and exercising additional weapon and drug search powers at Adelaide Oval during the Third Ashes Test, following the Bondi terror attack on Sunday.

item.title: CSIRO to receive $233 million in mid-year budget but up to 350 jobs still to be cut
item.description: Just a month after announcing 350 job cuts, the CSIRO has received a funding boost, but proposed job cuts will still happen, the national science agency says.

item.title: NSW parliament recalled to discuss gun reforms after Bondi Beach shooting
item.description: Premier Chris Minns said among the reforms to be discussed were proposed limits on the number of firearms a licensed shooter could own.

item.title: Falling tree kills farmer tackling blaze in Mindarabin, in WA's Great Southern
item.description: A 34-year-old farmer dies helping fight a fire in Mindarabin, in WA's Great Southern region.

item.title: Rays and sharks washed up on Kangaroo Island linked to algal bloom
item.description: Dead rays and sharks found along a regional South Australia beach have been linked to the algal bloom, the government confirms.

item.title: Bondi shooter Naveed Akram charged by NSW Police over terrorist attack
item.description: Naveed Akram has been charged over the terrorist attack that killed 15 people at Bondi Beach.

item.title: Australians are rushed and time-poor with most working unpaid hours
item.description: Most people spent time doing unpaid work in 2024, according to new data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics. It found women spent on average an hour more doing unpaid work than men.

item.title: Queensland records worst flu season in a decade, with cases 18 per cent up on last year
item.description: Official data shows more than 90,000 lab-confirmed cases of influenza in 2025, which is more than an 18 per cent jump on the number of cases reported last year.

item.title: Noosa Council blames 'human error' for $2.3 million AI scam
item.description: The Noosa Council is now blaming human error for a major fraud incident that cost ratepayers millions of dollars — while not acknowledging earlier supplier scam warnings.

item.title: Day-night Tests locked in for Australian summer until 2031
item.description: Cricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg opens up on the future of day-night Tests in the future summer schedule.

item.title: Talison Lithium will not reopen historic rail line from world's biggest lithium mine after finding it economically unviable
item.description: Talison Lithium rules out reopening a century-old rail line from the world's biggest lithium mine, despite ongoing complaints about truck traffic and dust.

item.title: Ashes drama for Steve Smith, Alex Carey and DRS — quick hits from day one of the third Test at Adelaide Oval
item.description: Australia's first-innings topscorers get some help from England's sloppy fielders and the DRS technology on a tightly contested day in Adelaide. Here are the quick hits from day one of the third Ashes Test.

item.title: Teenager jailed after stabbing doctor at Tasmanian hospital in 2023
item.description: A doctor went through a "lengthy, risky and complicated" surgery and continues to experience nightmares and flashbacks after being stabbed by a teenager he was treating in 2023, a court is told.

item.title: Tim Tszyu dominates Anthony Velazquez, wins on boxing return in Sydney
item.description: Tim Tszyu has dominated against unbeaten American Anthony Velazquez, winning by unanimous decision at the Sydney Entertainment Centre.

item.title: Alex Carey's maiden Ashes ton rescues Australia, delights Adelaide and elevates his status
item.description: Alex Carey looked to the heavens as his name rang out from the Adelaide Oval stands, his emotional century saving Australia's day one and furthering his push to one day stand among the great wicketkeeper-bats.

item.title: Cyril Mark Yeeda faces court over alleged $170k sale of alcohol in WA dry communities
item.description: Police allege Cyril Mark Yeeda sold $45,000 worth of alcohol in dry communities for $170,000.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Warner Bros Discovery board rejects rival $163bn bid from Paramount
item.description: In a letter to shareholders, the board wrote that Paramount had "consistently misled" Warner Bros shareholders that its $US30-per-share cash offer was fully guaranteed, or "backstopped," by the Ellison family,

item.title: Labor faces green 'Grinch' hospital funding accusations with a budget in the red
item.description: Labor has two options when it comes to straddling a budget in the red and accusations it has become a green Grinch on health funding.

item.title: Today in History, December 18: The lessons from Donald Trump's first impeachment trial
item.description: When Trump was elected president in 2016, he joined the world's most exclusive and revered club. But three years later, the president added his name to a smaller list of US leaders who'd been impeached.

item.title: How well do you know 2025 arts award winners?
item.description: The 2026 Oscars are just around the corner but let's give this year's arts award winners just a couple more moments in the sun.

item.title: AI-generated images of Bondi gunman used to spread false information
item.description: AI-generated images of Bondi gunman Naveed Akram in the Philippines and a fabricated Facebook page are spreading online. And an image of police officers taken out of context is debunked by ABC NEWS Verify.

item.title: The election is over, but inflation is still dominating the economic story
item.description: Jim Chalmers has started his second term as treasurer just like the first one ended: trying to frame the budget on his terms, but with one eye on inflation.

item.title: Government issues warning as mandatory registration for some NDIS providers confirmed
item.description: The government confirms two categories of NDIS providers will be subject to mandatory registration, more than a year after it was handed recommendations for how to implement a new system.

item.title: Why Trump's low-profile chief of staff Susie Wiles is making headlines
item.description: The long-time political operator is unusually candid during a series of interviews with magazine Vanity Fair.

item.title: England fume as Snicko operator admits error in Alex Carey reprieve in third Ashes Test
item.description: Snicko's boss admits an operator error dudded England out of the wicket of Alex Carey on day one of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

item.title: Prostate cancer survivor with incontinence speaks out about lack of men's sanitary bins
item.description: Prostate cancer survivor Mick Barrett is calling on businesses to consider installing rubbish bins inside men's bathrooms to help those with incontinence.

item.title: Outback town has 'zero' rental stock as new copper mine is set to increase housing pressure
item.description: When Leylanie moved her family back to her home town a year ago, she did not expect to be spending this Christmas still living out of a motel.

item.title: Victoria's gold boom continues as two big exploration tunnels approved
item.description: The Victorian government approves two companies to drill deep underground exploration tunnels amid a gold "renaissance" driven by high gold prices.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting updates: Sussan Ley calls on Albanese to recall parliament to address antisemitism — as it happened
item.description: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley calls on Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to recall parliament to address the issue of antisemitism in the community, in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Gun control debate heats up over proposed NSW firearm cap in wake of Bondi Beach shooting
item.description: Firearm restrictions proposed by the New South Wales government in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack would go far to reduce the growing number of guns across the state and prevent further harm, a gun control researcher says.

item.title: Aged care centres urged to budget for live entertainment to provide human connection
item.description: A performer and an advocate for older Australians are worried that live entertainment for aged care residents is on the decline as other leisure activities, such as virtual reality, gain popularity.

item.title: ASX ends flat as Boss Energy leads uranium rout — as it happened
item.description: The uranium sector weighed on the ASX after Boss Energy warned of lower expected output from its Honeymoon project, while the big iron ore miners gained ground. See how the trading day unfolded on the business blog.

item.title: Oscars to stream exclusively on YouTube from 2029, academy says
item.description: In a seismic shift for one of television's marquee events, the Academy Awards will depart US broadcaster ABC and begin streaming on YouTube, beginning in 2029.

item.title: Broken Hill arts community left in the lurch following funding cuts
item.description: Malyangapa Baaka Wiimpatja artist Leroy Johnson says the axing of an arts grant, which he is the last recipient of, has left the Broken Hill arts community feeling unsupported.

item.title: Outback Farm stars finish first barley harvest at Central Australian farm
item.description: Amid the red dirt, termite mounds and buffel grass, the first barley harvest is finished at Central Australia's Athelle Outback Hideaway.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Ben Stokes cramps, DRS woes continue as Pat Cummins, Nathan Lyon claim wickets on dominant day two at Adelaide Oval
item.description: Ben Stokes has dragged his battered, cramping body to the close on day two of the third Ashes Test, with the tourists chances of victory hanging by a thread.

item.title: Woodside chief executive Meg O'Neill resigns in move to BP
item.description: The chief executive of Perth-based oil and gas producer Woodside, Meg O'Neill, resigns from the company effective immediately in order to take up the same role at BP.

item.title: Coalition 'flabbergasted' by Labor's response to calls for Bondi royal commission into antisemitism
item.description: The opposition criticises the government for brushing aside calls for a royal commission into antisemitism as pressure mounts on Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to act in the wake of the deadly terror attack on Sydney's Jewish community.

item.title: Albanese announces tougher hate speech laws in wake of Bondi terror attack
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced sweeping reforms to crack down on antisemitism in the wake of the deadly terror attack on Sydney's Jewish community.

item.title: Two years out from FIFA's equal prize goal, the men's tournament's pool will be six times that of the women's
item.description: FIFA has announced a record prize money pool for the 2026 men's World Cup, but the figures are dwarfed by the riches on offer for the biggest club competitions, and fly in the face of the deadline for parity with the women's tournament.

item.title: Netwealth strikes ASIC deal to compensate First Guardian investors
item.description: Financial services company Netwealth has agreed to pay more than $100 million to more than 1,000 clients who invested in the failed First Guardian super fund through its platform.

item.description: From Australian-made gore to sugar-rush animation, here are the films that had our critics seated and watching this year.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Alex Carey's DRS controversy leaves experts questioning use of 'Snicko' technology
item.description: The use of "Snicko" in the Ashes is questioned after yet another DRS controversy in the third Ashes Test frustrates England and helps Alex Carey to a Test century.

item.title: Sam Kerr scores the winner as Chelsea makes it through to Women's Champions League quarterfinals
item.description: Sam Kerr heads in the winner as Chelsea secures a spot in the Women's Champions League quarterfinals.

item.title: New large-scale battery approval laws in Queensland draw mixed reaction
item.description: There have been big changes in the way battery energy storage systems are assessed in Queensland. Some rural communities applaud the shift, while industry groups say it risks investment.

item.description: This was a humbled prime minister. Showing contrition, some regret, and an acknowledgement more could have been done.

item.title: Australian National University stabber Alex Ophel 'may never be safe to be released into community'
item.description: The man who stabbed two Australian National University students in 2023 is given a nominated sentence of life to be carried out in a secure mental health facility.

item.description: Kerry Schott's report into the Triple Zero outage debacle increases pressure on Optus to implement 21 recommendations, some of them "urgent", and highlights numerous errors.

item.description: South Coast towns are calling for more funding to cope with a surge of recreational fishers as the region prepares to shut down recreational and commercial fishing.

item.description: Parts of WA's Indigenous community are in mourning, while others have mixed feelings, after a former mission where members of the Stolen Generation were institutionalised was partly destroyed in a bushfire.

item.description: FBI deputy director Dan Bongino will step down from his post next month, ending a short but tumultuous tenure as the bureau's second-highest-ranking official.

item.description: A NSW oyster grower is left reeling after tens of thousands of dollars' worth of equipment went up in flames just a week away from Christmas.

item.description: The future of an isolated tourism hotspot home to stunning waterfalls and ancient rock art is uncertain following a Federal Court hearing in Darwin.

item.description: The United States has approved its largest ever weapons package for Taiwan which is under increasing military pressure from China.

item.title: 'Children aren't born antisemitic': Education review aims to make Jewish students safer
item.description: The focus will turn from the threats outside the gate to those some critics say are embedded within education from a lack of Holocaust education to the harassment of Jewish students at universities.

item.description: The Victorian government turns to developer contributions and car park levies as it tries to raise more than $10 billion in funding for the first stage of the Suburban Rail Loop.

item.description: A series of strange decisions by umpires further erodes any trust in the DRS process as day two at the Adelaide Oval devolves into "shambles" and "chaos".

item.description: With only seven more sleeps until the big day, Western Australia looks like being the hottest capital city in the nation this Christmas.

item.description: Jewish Australians say the terror attack at Bondi Beach has left the community feeling angry, devastated and scared.

item.description: People who fully paid before the company collapsed can receive their vans if they pay an extra fee, while the majority of customers remain in limbo.

item.description: Ben Stokes and Jofra Archer share a robust conversation, Snicko is decried as "the worst ever" and another catching controversy. Here are the quick hits from day two of the third Ashes Test.

item.description: The circus comes to town in Adelaide with technological madness marring a second day which, more importantly, saw England wilt again and Australia tighten its grip on the Ashes.

item.description: An inquest has been examining the death of a newborn at Atherton Hospital and whether the care the mother and baby received were in any way responsible.

item.description: The US president's company also operates a number of cryptocurrency-related financial products and owns social media platform Truth Social.

item.description: Strenthened federal hate speech laws that the government held up as evidence it acted on antisemitism have been used four times since February, with it now conceding they do not go far enough.

item.description: As Australia's intelligence agencies look back over how the Bondi attackers were missed, a "grim reality" of their jobs confronts the country.

item.description: Travis Head scores his fourth century in a row at Adelaide Oval, and Alex Carey scores a half-ton as Australia's lead passes 350 on another dominant Ashes day.

item.description: The deal with Oracle, Silver Lake and MGX ensures the social video platform can continue operating in the US.

item.description: Mark Mitchell is known for bringing the fun to rubbish collection, donning different outfits and inspiring youngsters to follow in his footsteps. But this week is his final run.

item.description: Australian Cricketers Association boss Paul Marsh has called for an investigation into Snicko, saying careers are being affected by the technology's lack of precision.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Gun law debate raises questions about why some own scores of firearms
item.description: In the wake of the Bondi terror attack and upcoming government firearms restrictions, some people are asking why anyone would need to own 100 guns.

item.title: Communities rally to battle tragic fires near Ongerup and support each other in wake of tragedy
item.description: Following fatal fires in Western Australia's south earlier this week, stories are emerging of how homes were saved and communities rallied in the wake of tragedy.

item.title: Bedford creditors vote to hand over reins to The Disability Trust
item.description: Creditors have voted to support the sale of Bedford to NDIS provider The Disability Trust, which would guarantee the jobs of 1,100 workers.

item.title: Chris Scott re-signs as Geelong coach until the end of the 2029 AFL season
item.description: Already the longest serving coach in Geelong history, Chris Scott's new deal with the club will put him in the company of some of the AFL's greatest ever mentors.

item.title: Ben Stokes slows down and blows up, Travis Head makes Harry Brook pay for his drop — quick hits from day three of third Ashes Test
item.description: Harry Brook drops Travis Head on 99, which would have only soured the mood of his captain, who started the day already pretty ticked off. Here are the quick hits from day three of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

item.title: Travis Head, the last of Australia's larrikins, revels in his Ashes summer of love
item.description: Travis Head has become Australia's most beloved cricketer, and as another glorious Ashes century guided his team ever closer to the urn, he was eager to return the love.

item.title: The 'heroic' couple in twin coffins, a 'gifted musician' and a 'woman of integrity' laid to rest across Sydney
item.description: A couple hailed as "heroes in every sense of the word", a "gifted musician" and a "woman of integrity" have been farewelled in ceremonies across Sydney.

item.title: Marlinyu Ghoorlie native title group in Goldfields celebrates recognition as traditional owners
item.description: The result comes eight years after the native title claimant group first registered for native title, with a counterclaim by another group dismissed.

item.title: Search suspended for deep-sea diver Timothy Bennett in Coral Sea
item.description: A professional deep-sea diver, with several fish species named in his honour, is remembered as a loving father and well-respected in the science community for his contributions to the study of fish species.

item.title: ABC News - Trusted Source of Latest News & Headlines
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Smashed windscreen in remote SA unlikely caused by meteorite, museum says
item.description: Scientists were hoping an object that smashed the windscreen of a self-driving car in October was a meteorite, but SA Museum's investigation says it remains a mystery.

item.title: Famine ends in Gaza, Integrated Food Security Phase Classification report says
item.description: A report by the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification is still warning that over 100,000 children face malnutrition over the coming months.

item.title: Taipei Metro stabbing attack leaves at least three people dead
item.description: The suspect is also dead after falling from a building during a police chase.

item.title: Anthony Albanese faces primary test of his prime ministership in Bondi response
item.description: While the prime minister will forever struggle to shed the perception that he was too slow to recognise the threat to Australia's Jewish community, he is taking action.

item.title: US to miss deadline to release all Epstein files, Trump official admits
item.description: Deputy Attorney-General Todd Blanche says several hundred thousand Epstein-related documents should be released by the legal deadline, but several hundred thousand more could be a "couple of weeks" away.

item.title: Today in history: Picasso painting worth millions stolen in daring art heist
item.description: The 2007 Brazilian heist was not the last time a nimble thief made off with a Picasso. And as many Melburnians know, it certainly wasn't the first.

item.title: ABC 50/50 quiz: This week we're testing your knowledge on Fight Club, dog breeds and Nintendo
item.description: Every question has only two options: one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

item.title: Jewish man Gaby Silver never felt unsafe in Australia, then October 7 and Bondi happened
item.description: The rise in antisemitism in Australia since October 7 has reshaped the way Gaby Silver's family lives. After the Bondi attack, they're even more on edge.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: The teacher, driver and host who helped strangers take refuge during the Bondi terror attack
item.description: These are the stories of everyday people who stepped up during dark times, and of a community coming together when two gunmen sought to tear them apart on December 14.

item.title: How the Bondi shooters got access to now-banned guns
item.description: With Australia's strict gun laws, how was Sajid Akram able to legally own the gun he was using to slaughter innocent people in Bondi on December 14?

item.title: BOM Christmas weather forecast shows cool day in the east, searing heat in the west
item.description: Australia is experiencing a smorgasbord of wild weather in the lead-up to Christmas, featuring extreme heat, humidity, severe thunderstorms, and tropical storms all on the cards.

item.title: Grace Tame demands law reform after Diocese of Ballarat cleared of vicarious liability
item.description: In every Australian state and the NT, churches cannot be held vicariously liable for historical child sexual abuse perpetrated by their priests. Grace Tame is leading the charge for change.

item.title: Coronial inquest into deaths of cultural leaders Big Brother and Little Brother recommends spit hood ban
item.description: The NT coroner makes nine recommendations following an inquest into the deaths of two disabled Aboriginal brothers who spent a number of years homeless in Alice Springs.

item.title: Environmental experts, detection dogs team up to protect native freshwater turtles
item.description: A team of environmental experts, Indigenous rangers and conservation detection dogs is working on recovering the population of native freshwater turtles.

item.title: Records tumble as Matt Renshaw leads Brisbane Heat to stunning BBL victory over Perth Scorchers
item.description: Matt Renshaw and Jack Wildermuth pull off one of the greatest run chases in T20 history in a stunning Big Bash match at the Gabba.

item.title: Tobacco shop owner 'refusing to cooperate with police' after shakedown sign appears
item.description: Shop owners in the northern Victorian town of Swan Hill say they are concerned after a threatening note was left outside a store selling tobacco, demanding the owner "contact the commission".

item.title: What time is the Jake Paul and Anthony Joshua fight in Australia and how can you watch it?
item.description: The controversial fight between Jake Paul and Anthony Joshua has finally arrived. Here's everything you need to know.

item.title: Oxford evolutionary researcher says humans may have been kissing Neanderthals
item.description: Why is swapping saliva something all human societies have normalised? Turns out kissing isn't just a human thing — all sorts of species appear to kiss, and new research suggests Neanderthals did it too.

item.title: Melbourne University Women's Football Club was once a powerhouse. Now it's at risk of folding
item.description: Melbourne University is the latest women’s Aussie Rules club fighting for survival, but it is hoping intervention from an AFL executive can turn the club’s fortunes around.

item.title: Epstein files live updates: Jeffrey Epstein documents partially published by US Department of Justice
item.description: A trove of documents about the investigation into sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirator, Ghislaine Maxwell, has been published. Follow live as we analyse the files and the fallout.

item.title: Queensland family saves thousands of dollars after embracing the spirit of 'Thriftmas' over holiday period
item.description: Rising expenses across the festive season have driven a family of five in Brisbane to set a rule to only purchase Christmas presents from second-hand stores — and they've been pleasantly surprised by the treasures they've uncovered.

item.title: Former patients 'left waiting for justice' after damning report into Brisbane's Wolston Park Mental Hospital
item.description: Brisbane's Wolston Park Mental Hospital closed in 2001, but a 12-month review has shed light on its history of sexual abuse and patient mistreatment.

item.title: Queensland mayors and councillors to get pay rises between 3.25 and 4.5 per cent next financial year
item.description: The salary increases will see smaller council representatives given a 4.5 per cent pay rise, with 3.25 per cent raises on offer for larger council areas.

item.title: How are Australian parents responding to the social media ban for under-16s?
item.description: For some parents, the social media bans for under-16s have come as a relief. But others say they are fuelling conflict.

item.title: Epstein files partially released by US Department of Justice
item.description: The Trump administration publishes the first tranche of the Epstein files, but the release of hundreds of thousands of documents looks to have been delayed.

item.title: Dreams shattered as 140 Zone RV caravan customers' worst fears realised
item.description: About 140 customers of Zone RV have been told they will not be receiving their caravans after the company collapsed.

item.title: Health and safety case against Tasmania's Adams gin distillery dismissed in court
item.description: A work health and safety case against a distillery in Perth, northern Tasmania, is dismissed.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting live updates: Hundreds of lifesavers hold silent vigil for victims
item.description: Hundreds of surf lifesavers have gathered on Bondi Beach to pay tribute to the victims of last Sunday's terrorist attack. Follow live.

item.description: An infectious disease study hopes to see faster and earlier diagnosis of strep A to prevent chronic diseases in high-risk communities.

item.description: What is this group, which once ruled a territorial "caliphate" and inspired attacks all over the world?

item.title: Grace Lillian Lee weaves a path from the Torres Strait to Paris
item.description: Lee's woven, wearable art creations have catapulted her from Cairns and the Torres Strait to Paris, a bustling textile mecca more than 15,000 kilometres away.

item.title: The uninhabited Scottish isle where the sport of curling sources its most important resource
item.description: For all intents and purposes, Ailsa Craig looks like it has nothing to offer the human experience. But on its desolate shores, golden dreams are quietly being mined.

item.title: US strikes dozens of Islamic State targets in Syria, officials say
item.description: Described as "a declaration of vengeance" by US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, the strikes come after Donald Trump vowed retaliation for an attack on US personnel.

item.title: Ashes 2025 live updates: Brydon Carse misses hat-trick as Australia sets England 435 to win third Test at Adelaide Oval
item.description: Australia can win the Ashes faster than any team in over 100 years after setting England a record 435 runs to win the third Test at Adelaide Oval and keep the series alive. Follow live.

item.title: Paramatta Light Rail usage tipped to double next year despite numbers falling short in its first year
item.description: While rider numbers fell short of expectations in 2025, next year the number of trips taken on the Parramatta Light Rail is expected to double.

item.title: How a Queensland family is pushing for change after a devastating loss
item.description: Tyler Pask devoted his life to being an incredible father, selfless brother and a diligent emergency service worker for the Queensland Fire Department. Now his family is transforming their grief into encouraging other young men to access support for their mental health.

item.title: Tasmanian government faces questions over Pulse advertising spend after it asked for an election
item.description: The Tasmanian premier's department authorised more than $13,000 of taxpayer money to be spent with a local media organisation to promote the budget after the government asked for an election to be held, documents show.

item.title: Ambitious plan to share Carnarvon's food bowl both locally and statewide faces hurdles
item.description: Carnarvon's fresh produce could help Western Australia's food insecurity crisis, but there is concern not enough is being done to address the issue locally first.

item.title: NT housing market continues to grow as house prices climb across cities
item.description: First home buyers are being priced out of the Darwin property market by interstate investors looking to cash in on high rental yields, with many properties sold without even being listed.

item.title: Kalgoorlie the glittering prize for Frenchman Bruno Vincent
item.description: Bruno Vincent has spent his life searching for gold, so there was only one Australian city on his travel bucket list.

item.description: Jake Paul and former unified heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua meet in their highly-criticised boxing match in Miami on Netflix. Follow live.

item.title: NSW Premier Chris Minns backs calls for Royal Commission into Bondi Beach terror attack
item.description: New South Wales Premier Chris Minns is supporting calls for a Royal Commission to be held into the Bondi Beach terror attack, which claimed the lives of 15 innocent people.
